intro: Hyaenanche capensis, commonly known as the Cape hyaenanche, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that are typically arranged in a flat, disc-like structure. Hyaenanche capensis is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
